sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Frederik Dohr)
articles.description: It’s well-established that the web faces wide-ranging usability and performance issues, from user-hostile UI patterns and twisted search results to sluggish performance and battery-draining bloat. In this article, Frederik examines one small-but-significant aspect where developers take the reins: Painting pixels on the screen.
articles.title: Vanilla JavaScript, Libraries, And The Quest For Stateful DOM Rendering

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Color accessibility is more than just ticking boxes. Even with good contrast, some color palettes can make interfaces challenging for users. Here are some practical guidelines to ensure more inclusive design for colorblind people. An upcoming part of Smart Interface Design Patterns.
articles.title: A Practical Guide To Designing For Colorblind People

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Kate Kalcevich)
articles.description: Accessibility goes beyond making products user-friendly. It can significantly impact the quality of life for people with disabilities. Kate Kalcevich shares lessons she learned from assistive technology users — challenges and barriers they encounter on mobile devices.
articles.title: Mobile Accessibility Barriers For Assistive Technology Users

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Kent Eisenhuth)
articles.description: Accessibility for data visualization extends well beyond web standards, at least if you’re trying to create an experience that’s actually useful. This article focuses on techniques for creating useful and accessible visualizations that extend well beyond compliance.
articles.title: How Accessibility Standards Can Empower Better Chart Visual Design

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: How to design for children aged 3–12, with insights into user behavior, considerations for parents, and practical UX guidelines.
articles.title: A Practical Guide To Designing For Children

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Preethi Sam)
articles.description: A radar chart — also commonly called a spider chart — is yet another way to visualize data and make connections. Radar charts are inherently geometric, making them both a perfect fit and fun to make with CSS, thanks to the `polygon()` function. Read along as Preethi Sam demonstrates the process and sprinkles it with a pinch of JavaScript to make a handy, reusable component.
articles.title: How To Draw Radar Charts In Web

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Geoff Graham)
articles.description: What could we learn from entry-level students in front-end web development? As seasoned professionals, you might think you’ve seen it all, but the truth is that the newcomers are asking the most intriguing questions and making connections that those of us who have spent years on the front end may have never considered.
articles.title: Frequently Heard In My Beginning Front-End Web Development Class

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Juan Diego Rodríguez)
articles.description: An overwhelming number of frameworks and tooling available today gives the impression that web development has gotten perhaps too complex. Juan Diego Rodríguez explores if web development really is that complex and, most importantly, how we can prevent it from getting even more difficult than we already perceive it to be.
articles.title: Web Development Is Getting Too Complex, And It May Be Our Fault

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: With one billion people aged 60 or older worldwide, inclusivity is more important than ever. Learn how to create digital experiences that empower independence and competence for older adults while enhancing usability for all. An upcoming part of Smart Interface Design Patterns.
articles.title: A Guide To Designing For Older Adults

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Maximillian Piras)
articles.description: As Artificial Intelligence evolves the computing paradigm, designers have an opportunity to craft more intuitive user interfaces. Maximillian Piras examines how the latest AI capabilities can reshape the future of human-computer interaction beyond conversation alone.
articles.title: When Words Cannot Describe: Designing For AI Beyond Conversational Interfaces

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: With February just around the corner, how about a little inspiration boost? We might have one for you: desktop wallpapers created with love by the community for the community. Enjoy!
articles.title: 29 Days Of Inspiration (February 2024 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Andy Budd)
articles.description: Most product teams commonly adopt a feature-centric mindset, finding them convenient for brainstorming, drafting requirement documents, and integrating into backlogs and ticketing systems. In this article, Andy Budd shows how fixation with features might be holding you back and how making a few small tweaks to your process could make an entire world of difference.
articles.title: The Feature Trap: Why Feature Centricity Is Harming Your Product

articles.author: Nibesh Khadka
articles.description: As part of the Google CASA process [https://appdefensealliance.dev/casa], developers can run static analysis on their application’s source code using an inline integration with OpenText’s Fortify Source Code Analyzer (SCA) via the CASA portal. Naturally, I had to prepare my source code as per instruction. In this article, I will share
articles.title: How to Configure Google Workspace Addon For Tier 2 CASA Security Assessment – Step by Step Guide

articles.author: Quincy Larson
articles.description: On this week's episode of the podcast, I interview Logan Kilpatric, a software engineer and ChatGPT creator Open AI's first-ever Developer Advocate hire. The week Logan started, ChatGPT hit 100 million users. During our conversation, Logan shares his journey from Illinois to Harvard, NASA, and now the world's most-watched tech
articles.title: Podcast: What it's like working at ChatGPT Creator Open AI. My Interview with Logan Kilpatrick

articles.author: Nathan Sebhastian
articles.description: The Fetch API is a JavaScript function that you can use to send a request to any Web API URL and get a response. In this article, I'm going to show you how to make HTTP requests to external APIs using the JavaScript Fetch API. You're going to learn how
articles.title: JavaScript Fetch API For Beginners – Explained With Code Examples

articles.author: Sahil Mahapatra
articles.description: TypeScript, a superset of JavaScript, has gained widespread adoption among developers due to its ability to provide static typing, enhancing code robustness and maintainability. One of TypeScript's key features is interfaces, which play a pivotal role in defining the shape of objects, enabling type checking and facilitating better code organization.
articles.title: How TypeScript Interfaces Work – Explained with Examples

articles.author: Favour C. Felix
articles.description: Ever had to make a video call right on your browser with Google Meet, Zoom, or any other video chat app? Well, here’s what you might have never thought to ask—how does it work? Well, there are a number of things that make a real-time video chat application fully functional
articles.title: How to Build a Camera App on the Web – No Plugins Required

articles.author: James Charlesworth
articles.description:
For most of the history of CSS, selectors have been limited to targeting elements based on their parents in the DOM tree. Consider this HTML structure: 
     
Paragraph 1
       
     	
Paragraph 2
articles.title: How to Use the :has() Selector in CSS

articles.author: Hunor Márton Borbély
articles.description: How do you run a game created for the web in fullscreen? In this quick tutorial, you'll see how to display a game or any other HTML element in fullscreen, how to exit fullscreen, and how to make a nice fullscreen toggle button in SVG. Recently I published a long
articles.title: How to use the Fullscreen API in JavaScript

articles.author: Nathan Sebhastian
articles.description: Map and Set are two JavaScript data structures you can use to store a collection of values, similar to Objects and Arrays. They are specialized data structures that can help you store and manipulate related values.  In this tutorial, we will see how Map and Set work in detail
articles.title: How to Use the JavaScript Map and Set Objects – Explained with Code Examples

articles.author: Andrew Brown
articles.description: The Azure AI Fundamentals Certification is for those seeking a Machine Learning role such as AI Engineer or Data Scientist. The certification has recently been updated for 2024 and I've released an updated course to teach you how to pass the exam. In the last decade companies have been collecting
articles.title: Azure AI Fundamentals Certification (AI-900) 2024 UPDATE – Pass the Exam With This Free 4 Hour Course

articles.author: Sahil Mahapatra
articles.description: One of TypeScript's powerful features is type aliases, which allow developers to create custom names for types, enhancing code readability and maintainability. In this article, we'll explore TypeScript type aliases through examples. Table of Contents  * TypeScript Type Aliases  * Examples  * Conclusion What are Type Aliases
articles.title: How Type Aliases work in TypeScript – Explained with Code Examples
